aws::graph::propositions: # Helicopter Incident at Heliport
The pilot of N911FA did not realize that the parked helicopter N96BM was not in the designated box.
The pilot of N911FA believed the other helicopter was in the box.
The pilot of N911FA thought paying attention to her box when landing would be sufficient.
The pilot of N911FA had not observed a helicopter placed outside of the box in her experience.
N96BM is a helicopter.
N911FA is a helicopter.
The pilot of N96BM arrived at the heliport for his duty shift at 1500.
The pilot of N96BM performed a maintenance flight check.
The pilot of N96BM recalled rain cells to the south with 4-5 miles visibility.
The pilot of N96BM recalled a 2,000 foot ceiling.
The pilot of N96BM spoke to the pilot of N911FA around 1530.
The pilot of N96BM told the pilot of N911FA that there was weather and rain cells to the south.
The pilot of N96BM was pushing out N96BM when a call for assistance was requested.
N911FA had already departed when the call for assistance came.
The pilot of N96BM moved N96BM to Pad 1.
The pilot of N96BM placed the helicopter on the outside of Pad 1.
The pilot of N96BM knew they would be off the ground in a couple of minutes or he would be up on radios.
The pilot of N96BM planned to check the weather when he was up on radios.
The pilot of N96BM planned to request the pilot of N911FA start toward the priority call.
The pilot of N96BM stated it was not uncommon to place the helicopter outside of the box.
The pilot of N96BM had witnessed other pilots place helicopters outside the box.
The pilot of N96BM believed helicopters were placed outside the box due to poor water drainage when it rained.
The pilot of N96BM believed helicopters were placed outside the box to keep clearance from the adjacent fuel farm.
The Tactical Flight Officer (TFO) for N96BM was directed by the pilot as they pushed the helicopter outside.
The mechanic for N96BM was directed by the pilot as they pushed the helicopter outside.
The TFO confirmed they did not place the helicopter inside the box for pad 1.
The helicopter N96BM was parked to the west of the box.
The TFO recalled putting on his gear at the helicopter.
The TFO recalled climbing into the helicopter.
The TFO recalled seat belting himself in the helicopter.
A lieutenant came to the TFO's side of the helicopter.
The lieutenant asked if they wanted to respond due to the weather.

text:
# Incident Report

## The Pilot's Account
The pilot stated that at the time she did not realize that the parked helicopter (N96BM) was not in the box. Her state of mind was that the other helicopter was in the box, so pay attention to your box when you land, and you'll be fine.

In her experience, she had not observed a helicopter placed outside of the box.

## Pilot N96BM
According to the pilot, he had arrived at the heliport for his duty shift at 1500. He had performed a maintenance flight check, and recalled that there were rain cells to the south with 4-5 miles visibility and a 2,000 foot ceiling. About 1530 he spoke to the pilot of N911FA, and that he had told the other pilot that there was weather and rain cells to the south.

He stated that he had been pushing out N96BM when a call for assistance was requested, as N911FA had already departed he moved N96BM to Pad 1. The pilot stated that he placed the helicopter on the outside of Pad 1; he knew they would be off the ground in a couple of minutes or he would be up on radios. The pilot stated that his thought process was that, when he was up on radios he would check the weather, and request the pilot of N911FA start toward the priority call.

The pilot stated that it was not uncommon to place the helicopter outside of the box, and he had witnessed other pilot's do the same. He opined that it was done due to poor water drainage when it rained as well as to keep clearance from the adjacent fuel farm.

## Other Witnesses
The Tactical Flight Officer (TFO) for N96BM stated that he and the mechanic were being directed by the pilot as they pushed the helicopter outside, and that they did not place the helicopter inside the box for pad 1, instead it was parked to the west of the box.

The TFO recalled putting on his gear at the helicopter, climbing in and seat belting himself in. The lieutenant came to his side of the helicopter, and asked if they wanted to respond due to the weather.
